msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
1st pass of rename according to the spec http://opensource.adobe.com/wiki/display/flexsdk/Dropping+the+Fx+Prefix

Flex now requires CSS Style declarations to declare @namespace rules and disambiguate between halo and spark components using CSS 3 namespace prefixes on type selectors. At compile time, this namespace information will be used to map type names to qualified ActionScript class names. At runtime, type selectors are matched on qualified ActionScript class name (for example mx.controls.Button rather than just Button). Flex 3 applications must be compiled with -compatibility-version=3.0.0 to get unqualified CSS type selector behavior.
QE: Yes, this build may help in updating test cases to use the new namespaces and class names.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
SDK-19845 Straight-line paths do not seem to render properly.
The Path was not protecting against zero value width or height when drawing the segments.
Fixed bug in FxSpinner where all keyboard events were not bubbling. Instead, what we want is for the UP/DOWN/HOME/END keyDown events to not bubble.
Updated function name in FxSlider to follow event handler function naming convention.
QE Notes: Add tests for vertical or horizontal line Paths
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Update action script files with asdoc version tags.
Doc Notes: Please review and update as necessary.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
A variety of fixes to Spinner and NumericStepper that exposed some inaccuracies in Range. All discovered while fixing SDK-17822.

Additionally, added the extractValueFunction which is the sibling property to displayFormatFunction. Both can be set on a Spark NumericStepper to modify the value displayed in the text input and to extract the correct value for internal representation.
Mustella tests: Pass (NS, Spinner, ScrollBar, Slider)
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
SkinStates metadata change.  Now each skin state is enumerated on its own line with its own metadata ([SkinState("normal")] instead of [SkinStates("normal", "disabled")])
Also changed the builds so that we don't keep unnecessary metadata around anymore at runtime (SkinStates, HostComponent, and States fall into this category).
tests: checkintests, mustella SkinnableComponent, FxButton, FxToggleButton, Group, DataGroup
